intro: Trichosporum zamboangense, commonly known as the Zamboanga trichosporum, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
